greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerators of the polylogarithm li(-n,-1/2)/2.
comment: Given an integer n>0, consider the infinite series s(n) = li(-n,-1/2)) = SUM((-1)^k)(k^n)/2^k) for k=1,2,... Then s(n)=2*a(n)/A131137(n+1).
link: S. Sykora, Finite and Infinite Sums of the Power Series (k^p)(x^k), Stan's Library Vol.I, April 2006, updated March 2012. See Eq.(29).
formula: Recurrence: s(n+1)=(-1/3)*SUM(C(n+1,i)*s(i)), where i=0,1,2,...,n, and C(n,m) are the binomial coefficients, with the starting value of s(0)=2/3.
mathematica: nn = 30; s[0] = 1; Do[s[n+1] = (-1/3) Sum[Binomial[n+1,i] s[i], {i, 0, n}], {n, 0, nn}]; Numerator[Table[s[n], {n, 0, nn}]] (* _T. D. Noe_, Mar 20 2012 *)
results.author: _Stanislav Sykora_, Mar 19 2012
